intro: Synotis duclouxii, commonly known as the Ducloux's synotis, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within the rainforests of Madagascar. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
